question: Which two nations share the location of "La Amistad International Park"?
explanation: La Amistad International Park lies between Costa Rica and Panama. It is a Transboundary Protected Area of Latin America. This park is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is located in the Talamanca Mountain Range. It is the largest natural reserve in Central America and has a tropical forest type of vegetation. This park is a part of the Mesoamerican Biological Corridor and it houses five species of big cats such as pumas, ocelots, margay, jaguars and jaguarundis.
